JCoverage (http://www.jcoverage.com) doesn't generate the tests for 
you b=
ut it can report on your test coverage (both line and branch).

It is a fre=
e, open-source tool. I've found it useful.

Craig

>>> hehaifengcn@...=
m 10/06/2003 10:45:11 am >>>
I have a project in which I want to some tools=
 that can automatically 
generate test case to exercise given execution pat=
h. The path is 
derived from bytecode but may be ablt to map back to source=
 code 
level. 

For example, I have a fuction

void fun(int a, int b)
{
1  =
a=3D=3Db;
2  if (a<b){
3     x=3D=3Da;
4  }else{
5    x=3D=3Db;
6}
7
}

And=
 suppose I want the execution path is (1,2, 3, 7). I need a tool 
for gener=
ating an input for the path. 

I try to use JTest  but not able to find any=
 feature in Jtest which 
can do the task. I wonder if there any tool which =
has that feature? 
Can JUnit perform it?

Thank you
